Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_nbpnbeEmZi1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/7civZQPbUV4" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><strong>HatBat</strong> and <strong>Suestra Gaming</strong> have teamed up to create a movie that continues the Macey Dean saga. While this is just a teaser for it, we already have high hopes for <strong>Spirit of Kerbin</strong>.</p>
wow. looks interesting
Been looking for something like this.

Amazing clip! I noticed, however, Astronomer's visual pack and... universe replacer? For the Kerbals? Anyway, these are great, but I was just wondering if the rest of it is still going to be kept stock (parts, etc.) In my opinion, that's half of what made the original series so amazing. Just curious.

I hope he keeps it true to the original series and leaves it all stock! Adding a bunch of gun mods would kind of ruin the fun crude weapon nature of the ships! I'm also wondering if he is open to ship submissions like Macy was in the last episode... If so I have a couple dozen designs ranging from small to computer eating that he may find interesting! Either way it looks like the new series is going to be great!
Congrats, Hatbat 'N' Suestra! May the force be with you.
I never followed the original series, but this looks very good.

I hope he keeps it true to the original series and leaves it all stock! Adding a bunch of gun mods would kind of ruin the fun crude weapon nature of the ships! I'm also wondering if he is open to ship submissions like Macy was in the last episode... If so I have a couple dozen designs ranging from small to computer eating that he may find interesting! Either way it looks like the new series is going to be great!

Yes, over here.

Congrats, Hatbat 'N' Suestra! May the force be with you.
I never followed the original series, but this looks very good.
wow. looks interesting
Been looking for something like this.

Thanks guys, and a big thanks to the guys at squad for highlighting me again. You're too kind

Amazing clip! I noticed, however, Astronomer's visual pack and... universe replacer? For the Kerbals? Anyway, these are great, but I was just wondering if the rest of it is still going to be kept stock (parts, etc.) In my opinion, that's half of what made the original series so amazing. Just curious.

Suestra and I agreed when we were planning that part packs and other part related mods were out of the question other than things that ultimately won't effect what happens in the film. As for visual mods, well: Astronomer is a friend of mine so it's a given that I use his mod in all my videos and no, it's texture replacer equipped with the Green Skull Inc add-on that enables the changing of suits (their not the SW/HL colours in the video, just random).

I hope he keeps it true to the original series and leaves it all stock! Adding a bunch of gun mods would kind of ruin the fun crude weapon nature of the ships! I'm also wondering if he is open to ship submissions like Macy was in the last episode... If so I have a couple dozen designs ranging from small to computer eating that he may find interesting! Either way it looks like the new series is going to be great!

Don't worry, Suestra and I aren't even considering using a gun mod; I also loved how stock weapons effected Macey's series.

For now I think it's best that people keep ship designs for the film to themselves (I'd be more than happy to accept them for my own series though).

Yes, over here.

Sorry, but that thread is for my series and only my series. Due primarily to it having so many rules that contradict the rules that Macey laid out for his own submissions. Besides, there are already so many amazing designs at me and Suestras disposal in the Spirit Wolf/Hanlan submissions thread and the submissions email. Of course, we will be using new ships; but we'll most likely be using a contracting system wherein we gather a group of builders to build certain ships that are required in the script.

Thanks guys, and a big thanks to the guys at squad for highlighting me again. You're too kind

[snip]

I think I'm going to like this. A lot.

Any plans on using my music in this or any future project? You said you were interested about this a little while back.

I think I'm going to like this. A lot.

Any plans on using my music in this or any future project? You said you were interested about this a little while back.

I thought you'd never ask

At the moment I'm getting a few ideas from 'EVE' and 'DUNA', I'll PM you when I decide on something final.
Congrats Hatbat

It was only a matter of time before this happened. Within the first week though is amazing.

EDIT: Your views have doubled since I checked earlier:D

I think this would be much better if the ships were all stock, that's one of the things that made Macey Dean's series special and it doesn't seem right. But the cinematic is brilliant, congrats.

I think this would be much better if the ships were all stock, that's one of the things that made Macey Dean's series special and it doesn't seem right. But the cinematic is brilliant, congrats.

They are all stock. Where'd you see any modded ships?
I thought you said in the submission thread that the cinematic was to use ships using the new B9 parts, did you mean a different cinematic?

I thought you said in the submission thread that the cinematic was to use ships using the new B9 parts, did you mean a different cinematic?

Yeah, I was talking about the B9 BattleStar cinematic I'm making on the side. You should ask mission controller if you want to see the preview, I gave it to him as a reward for helping me out.
Well now I just feel silly... I'll go hide in the corner now...

Yeah, I was talking about the B9 BattleStar cinematic I'm making on the side. You should ask mission controller if you want to see the preview, I gave it to him as a reward for helping me out.
